description:
Azotobacter beijerinckii is a species of free-living, aerobic, and nitrogen-fixing bacteria. It belongs to the genus Azotobacter, which are known for their ability to convert atmospheric nitrogen into a form that can be utilized by plants and other organisms.

Azotobacter beijerinckii is a Gram-negative, motile bacterium that is typically found in soil and aquatic environments. It is known for its ability to produce a variety of extracellular polysaccharides, which can help protect the cells from desiccation and other environmental stresses.

The nitrogen-fixing capabilities of Azotobacter beijerinckii are facilitated by the presence of the nitrogenase enzyme complex, which catalyzes the reduction of atmospheric nitrogen (N2) to ammonia (NH3). This process provides a valuable source of fixed nitrogen, which can be utilized by plants and other organisms for growth and development.

Azotobacter beijerinckii is considered an important microorganism in the context of sustainable agriculture, as it can contribute to the natural enrichment of soil with nitrogen, reducing the need for synthetic fertilizers. Additionally, its ability to produce various metabolites and enzores makes it a subject of interest for biotechnological applications.
